### canLowerReturn() {#a594b4a593c2315ee7e75b15410643097}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::CallLowering::canLowerReturn (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">CallingConv::ID</a> CallConv, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/basearginfo">BaseArgInfo</a> &gt; &amp; Outs, bool IsVarArg) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This hook must be implemented to check whether the return values described by <code>Outs</code> can fit into the return registers.

If false is returned, an sret-demotion is performed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h/#l00507">507</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h">CallLowering.h</a>.

### lowerCall() {#af5462628f10dea9944615cd509dd3634}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CallLowering::lowerCall (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineirbuilder">MachineIRBuilder</a> &amp; MIRBuilder, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &amp; Call, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; ResRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; &gt; ArgRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> SwiftErrorVReg, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/ptrauthinfo">PtrAuthInfo</a> &gt; PAI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> ConvergenceCtrlToken, std::function&lt; unsigned()&gt; GetCalleeReg) const</>}>
Lower the given call instruction, including argument and return value marshalling.

<code>CI</code> is the call/invoke instruction.

<code>ResRegs</code> are the registers where the call&#39;s return value should be stored (or 0 if there is no return value). There will be one register for each non-aggregate type, as returned by <code>computeValueLLTs</code>.

<code>ArgRegs</code> is a list of lists of virtual registers containing each argument that needs to be passed (argument <code>i</code> should be placed in <code>ArgRegs</code>&#91;i&#93;). For each argument, there will be one register for each non-aggregate type, as returned by <code>computeValueLLTs</code>.

<code>SwiftErrorVReg</code> is non-zero if the call has a swifterror inout parameter, and contains the vreg that the swifterror should be copied into after the call.

<code>GetCalleeReg</code> is a callback to materialize a register for the callee if the target determines it cannot jump to the destination based purely on <code>CI</code>. This might be because <code>CI</code> is indirect, or because of the limited range of an immediate jump.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the lowering succeeded, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h/#l00596">596</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h">CallLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-cpp/#l00093">93</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-cpp">CallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### lowerFormalArguments() {#a58307def319bb185729ec87853b193e9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::CallLowering::lowerFormalArguments (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineirbuilder">MachineIRBuilder</a> &amp; MIRBuilder, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; &gt; VRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functionloweringinfo">FunctionLoweringInfo</a> &amp; FLI) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This hook must be implemented to lower the incoming (formal) arguments, described by <code>VRegs</code>, for GlobalISel.

Each argument must end up in the related virtual registers described by <code>VRegs</code>. In other words, the first argument should end up in <code>VRegs</code>&#91;0&#93;, the second in <code>VRegs</code>&#91;1&#93;, and so on. For each argument, there will be one register for each non-aggregate type, as returned by <code>computeValueLLTs</code>. <code>MIRBuilder</code> is set to the proper insertion for the argument lowering. <code>FLI</code> is required for sret demotion.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
True if the lowering succeeded, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h/#l00555">555</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h">CallLowering.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determineAssignments() {#ac6db7ce806dd7cbdce7f3c1b06dcd54e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CallLowering::determineAssignments (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valueassigner">ValueAssigner</a> &amp; Assigner, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/arginfo">ArgInfo</a> &gt; &amp; Args, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccstate">CCState</a> &amp; CCInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Analyze the argument list in <code>Args</code>, using <code>Assigner</code> to populate <code>CCInfo</code>.

This will determine the types and locations to use for passed or returned values. This may resize fields in <code>Args</code> if the value is split across multiple registers or stack slots.

This is independent of the function state and can be used to determine how a call would pass arguments without needing to change the function. This can be used to check if arguments are suitable for tail call lowering.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
True if everything has succeeded, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

### getTLI() {#aea33ec3a4c249352965ac6bf4dde8226}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class XXXTargetLowering&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>const XXXTargetLowering &#42; llvm::CallLowering::getTLI () const</>}

### resultsCompatible() {#a479378216af352a6202281eb9b5b202a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CallLowering::resultsCompatible (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/callloweringinfo">CallLoweringInfo</a> &amp; Info, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/arginfo">ArgInfo</a> &gt; &amp; InArgs, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valueassigner">ValueAssigner</a> &amp; CalleeAssigner, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valueassigner">ValueAssigner</a> &amp; CallerAssigner) const</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True if the calling convention for a callee and its caller pass results in the same way. Typically used for tail call eligibility checks.
</SectionUser>

<code>Info</code> is the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/callloweringinfo">CallLoweringInfo</a> for the call. <code>MF</code> is the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> for the caller. <code>InArgs</code> contains the results of the call. <code>CalleeAssigner</code> specifies the target&#39;s handling of the argument types for the callee. <code>CallerAssigner</code> specifies the target&#39;s handling of the argument types for the caller.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h/#l00446">446</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-h">CallLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-cpp/#l01191">1191</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-cpp">CallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### splitToValueTypes() {#a57d1263b6f2a16c765d594a59c2f8130}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void CallLowering::splitToValueTypes (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/arginfo">ArgInfo</a> &amp; OrigArgInfo, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/arginfo">ArgInfo</a> &gt; &amp; SplitArgs, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">CallingConv::ID</a> CallConv, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; uint64&#95;t &gt; &#42; Offsets=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Break <code>OrigArgInfo</code> into one or more pieces the calling convention can process, returned in <code>SplitArgs</code>.

For example, this should break structs down into individual fields.

If <code>Offsets</code> is non-null, it points to a vector to be filled in with the in-memory offsets of each of the individual values.
